column1: spoken_words
I'll deal with your insubordinate wordplay later. My first duty is to get you boys to safety and that's... where's Ralph?
... so, from now on anything caught in your zipper will be handled by the school nurse, and not me. And now... are you adequately prepared to rock?
Look at that Comic Book Fellow calmly eating candy like a Spaniard. Time for monkey to shine.
One... more... time! HELLO MA BABY... HELLO MA HONEY... HELLO MY RAGTIME GAL. DOUBLETIME, NOW. SEND ME A KISS BY WIRE...
Mattingly, I thought I told you to trim those sideburns. Go home! You're off the team! For good!
In closing, gentle reader, I'd like to thank you. What's that you say? Me thanking you? No, it's not a misprint. For you see, I enjoyed writing this book as much as you enjoyed reading it. The end.
Well, some say being thoughtful is old-fashioned. If so, then I guess I'm just a cave man. If they existed, which they didn't!
Very well, you had your chance. I'm going to shred you like a Christmas card! Now, get out.
Go back to bed, Mother! I've got it under control. Listen, you crumb-bums, if you think I'm impressed, I am not!
You know what's great about you, Betty, is you're letting your looks go gracefully. You're not all hung up on looking "attractive" and "desirable". It's just so rare and refreshing.
Ah. 206 bones... fifty miles of small intestine... full, pouting lips. Why, this fellow is less a snowman than a god.
That's what you're smelling, Homer! Oh, if it weren't for this blasted fog, we'd be saved!
You know, lighthearted. Fancy free. "Mothers lock up your daughters, Smithers is on the town!"

Well I'll make these rioters regret their folly. This prison will make Abu Ghraib look like the Four Seasons. Smithers, we'll need electrical wire, a hood and someone who can really point at genitalia.
Yeah, I figured out that the best way for me to get along with most people is to be kept behind a two foot chunk of solid oak.
My first dollar! Thanks to you, Lisa, and our hemp-smoking friend. Shine on, you crazy diamond.
"...But I reckon I got to light out for the Territory ahead of the rest, because Aunt Sally she's going to adopt me and civilize me, and I can't stand it. I been there before."
But neighbor... why did you have to do this? I've tattled this town into a paradise!
Strange. I shouldn't have been able to hear that. Anyway, a Hollywood studio has decided to film the Radioactive Man movie here in Springfield.
Dear Lord, I know you see all, but trust me, you do not want to see this.
That intrepid lad is my great grandfather! Franklin Jefferson Burns. Tossing that tea without a care for what the caffeine would do to the Fenway Flounder.
That's it. Frimble about with your widgets and doobobs. It'll all be a monument to futility when my plan comes to fruition.
Sixty Minutes -- Morley Safer has questionable pants fold -- "The L Word" -- used the "L" word.
Aaaaaand freeze! Now, who in Springfield will eat the poisoned broth? Whoo, it could be anyone, even Mr. Burns.
...and I know the little fellas would love romping around my many acres, chasing my many cars, drinking from my many toilets...
Ho-ho-ho! Why bother, baby? One smoke detector's enough for Mad Dog. Now let's hit the sack.
Yeah, I wanna send her two dozen roses. And I wanna put something nice on the card, like, um, "Renee, my treasure..."
The best photographs, or "photos", will be prominently displayed in the school lobby all year long.
Children, I hope we all have a pleasant and orderly day here at "Satan's Anvil." No one knows why the early settlers called it that, and I suppose we never will.
I see you're new to town -- maybe I could uh, show you around? I know a terrific tavern...

That concludes our Halloween show for this year. I just want to say that for watching this network, you're all going to Hell. And that includes FX, Fox Sports and our newest Devil's portal, The Wall Street Journal! Welcome to the club!
All right, before I send this, I'd better, uh, un-beady the eyes... de-Neanderthal the brow... smooth out my hate lines... lighten up the ear hair... switch my lips...
Therefore, space in the fallout shelter will be reserved for Lisa Simpson, Martin Prince, our championship kickball team, and Sherri, but not Terri.
So ironic. After all my years of stock jobbing, gun running, attempted murder, successful murder, and tom peepery, they get me on a petty multi-million dollar art theft.
Hitting it off already! I haven't seen such a natural pair since half-sandwich and soup of the day.
Increased job satisfaction and family togetherness are poison for a purveyor of mind-numbing intoxicants like myself.
Oh hey there, Liser. Just oiling the old door here. Finally silenced that mournful wail.
Oh, indeedily-doodily. I've even been in "Streetcar" once before. I played Blanche DuBois! Hmmm huh. Just part of the fun of going to an all-male school.
JUST ONCE I WISH CUPID / WOULD DRAW BACK HIS BOW / AND SHOOT ME A CUTIE / WHOSE STANDARDS ARE LOW...
Oh, Marge called you. She said... uh... that she loves you and she hopes you break the guy's arm so hard that it pokes through his skin.
Okay, Homer. I'm ready to learn. What's the first lesson? Just give me the topic sentence.
Oh yeah, settlement? Fine! Hang your heads in shame, you over-priced, under-brained, glorified notary publics! Just get that big ape to my house tonight and we'll buy him off with a banana or two.

All right, everyone. It's time for your Christmas "boni." Everyone gets a five dollar cafeteria voucher...and for your boy, a confectioner's card featuring a current baseballer. It's that rookie from the New York Nine.
Her shapely gams have finally persuaded me to switch from the Julian calendar to the Gregorian!
Now there's nothing to do now but sit back and wait for the kudos to roll in.
He taught us how to live a Burt Reynolds lifestyle on a Mac Davis income. We've already got tickets for his next seminar.
Don't forget, Christmas is a wonderful time to take up alcoholism. You see your family all year round. The holidays are for your bartender.
So, I guess you didn't eat that "special cheese" that I gave you yesterday, huh?
I see it all now! You're just a bunch of yesmen! I was making the wrong moves and you were too gutless to tell me. Isn't that right?
Wow, no one's ever been happy in this place before. And when I started it was Moe's Ice Cream Carnival. Not good.
It's a remarkable thing. In the short time you were gone, I learned to be completely self reli--
Sometimes Maude, God bless her, she underlines passages in my Bible because she can't find hers.
Yep, I'm just replacing the front window at my store, which was broken in the riot.
Hello. My name is Mr. Snrub, and I come from... eh, someplace far away. Yes, that will do. Anyway, I-I say we invest that money back in the nuclear plant.
I've got two teens in a public park goin' at it like a couple of gibbons in the back seat of Noah's Ark!
Let's see, social security number... naught-naught-naught, naught-naught, naught-naught-naught-two. Damn Roosevelt. Cause of parents' death... Got in my way.
Bum-ba-bum-bum! Ba-ba-ba-bum! Now a little more allegro than last time. Bart! Welcome! Can I offer you a Diet Caffeine-Free Dr. Pepper or an individual fruit cocktail cup?
Well, I was gonna erase those two apostrophes and replace 'em with 'g's, but that's about it. So, you know, call anytime.
Well, now that I'm forcibly retired, I feel I should give back to society and do some charitable work. But first, I want to take a lot of opium.
No, you can still turn back! The point of no return is the whispered huddle.
Okay, okay, uh... prepare to be kissed... here we go... giving in to my natural urges... okay, a few jumping jacks just to warm up...

The 2nd Battle of Springfield was fought by the North...the South...and the East...to keep Springfield in, out of, and next to the Union, respectively. Now, the actual battle was fought over there, where that man is standing. But he won't move, so we'll do it here.
Well, this was a big bust. Come on, kids. Let's go home to our mothers.
Smithers, I'm a proud fellow, and it's not easy for me to admit defeat. But I know just the thing to make me feel better -- shopping!

I got Marge's mother to go to Marge, convinced Helen to ride the rails of romance with the padre, then I bought some roadside corn, ate it raw, got a kernel in my teeth, flossed with the corn silk, and then I came over to fix things with Manjula.
Maybe the planet wants a strong man to take her by the hand and lead her!
Well, actually, I picked up some extra cash renting out my house to a fraternity.
You will take art, you will enjoy art, and you will make something in a kiln your mother can use.
Mouse pad! Double click! Skyyype! Uh, Skyyype! Matthew twenty-three: "Then spake Jesus to the multitude, and to his disciples, saying--"
Snappy, do you it's hard to imagine, but I was once a barefoot boy with cheek of tan. I dreamed of grand slam homeruns and wiping out nations with the stroke of a pen.
Hey Marge, I don't I don't really want a computer. You know all those complete strangers Googling each other. Makes my flesh crawl.
Yeah, that's probably a good one. Here, I got somethin' that might cheer ya up.
Yes, but I couldn't understand a word that man said. Misht Burnsh, dajna boo mafrn friszner... er hound-dog.
Oh well, I used to rile the late, great Connie Mack with that one at old Shibe Park.
Well, I'm all for rescuing the kids, but I wish you hadn't sawed off my roof.

Well, perhaps I was being a tad glib. Let me explain. Our elementary school participates in a foreign exchange program. Now normally, a student is selected on the basis of academic excellence or intelligence, but in Bart's case I'm prepared to make a big exception. And, if you're willing to play along, he can spend the next three months studying far, far away.
...annnd that concludes tonight's auction, which has raised a school record one hundred and sixteen thousand dollars!
It's because I believe every soul has the possibility of salvation. At least I thought so till now. Homer Simpson, you are not worth saving.
Homer, what you do is go down to window nine at the courthouse. You slip the guy a hundred bucks and your record is as clean as... uh, I ain't got nothin' clean to compare it to.
Uh, now children, if you have to answer nature's call during the night, use this bucket next to Bart's head.
Rafting, eh? It's a perfect way to entertain them. Finally, humanity has found a use for water.
But I'll need someone to watch my house. Who's that fellow who always screws up and creates havoc?
Well children, I don't know what you did to all those substitutes, but it's going to stop now. Leopold?
Agreed. The film has everything -- emotion, conflict, Milhouse! Lisa, you're a gifted filmmaker. It's as if Ingmar Bergman and Penny Marshall had a baby.
Well, that's it. I've lost them forever. Now I'd like to introduce you to Lunchlady Doris, who will serve you healthy, nutritious meals...
And to think, Smithers -- you laughed when I bought Ticketmaster. "Nobody's going to pay a 100% service charge."
The students will do anything she says. She's captured their imagination like a bright piece of construction paper.
Aw, leave me out of this, Homer. Games of chance are strictly forbidden by Deuteronomy seven--

What are you? You're like a monster! That's like the worst thing I ever heard anybody do to anybody. You should be drinkin' watered-down beer in-in-in a chipped glass, on a stool with a nail sticking up.
Well, I... you see... it's just is it a crime to want nice things? And then to steal them from a public museum where any gum-chewing monkey in a Tufts University jacket can gawk at them? I think not!

Well, you're in for a whale of a show tonight. I'd like to point out that the doors are now locked, so you parents can't sneak out of the show after your own child has performed. Oh, and let me caution the people in the first five rows, you will get wet.
"'Zounds" is a renaissance English word, short for "God's Wounds." But uh, "smite-ly," that's pure Flanders!
Geez, Homer, this guy is bringin' the whole bar down. I finally got Barney back on the sauce. If he doesn't have fun, he could easily slip right back into sobriety.
D'oh. Now Bart, in light of your recent service to the school, I've decided to be lenient. Four hundred days detention.
Oyster shells, hand painted to resemble Lucille Ball! You'll love Oyster Lucy! Oh Mr. Mooney, I just gotta meet Bob Cummings. Vivvv!!!
Well, Homer, our kids showed us something today, huh? By working together, we can both be winners. Thank heaven neither of us has to go through with that silly wager. Put 'er there, pal.
Uh, excuse me, fellas... I... I couldn't help thinking it might be nice if you could uh, vamoose, you know. If possible.
Ho-ho-ho, you betcha. Team sports'll keep you away from temptations like rock music and girls.
Darn right, I'm the boss. Don't forget, I can send you back where you came from... college boy.
All right, let's cut to the chase. My board has given me permission to go up to... twelve goats.
A lot of people have cell phones, but I like to eat healthy. So I invented... the celery phone! Hello? Hello?
Howya doin' there? Uh, your front door was locked, so, uh, rather than call or knock, I, uh, came down the chimbley there.

Heh, heh. As well they might. You know, Smithers, when I was a young buck, my patented fadeaway pitch was compared by many to the "trouble ball" of the late great Satchel Paige. Spit on this for me, Smithers.
You're right. We're getting screwed! There must be something I can do about this. Wait! Yes! I think I know just the thing!
So, uh, what's a Princesses like you do all day, eh? A lot of spinning wheels and witches treatin' you like crap?
Although this millennium is still young, I feel it is time to award this giant trophy paid for with your healthcare cuts...
I am only eighty-one. You may find this hard to believe... but in my salad days, my crowning glory was a bright shock of strawberry blond curls.
Shove off, puke-holes. Get out of there! These stools are reserved for the mayor and his cronies.
You have our deepest condol-diddly-olences. I'm sorry. I'm just nervous, I didn't mean any disrespect.
Yeah. A crazy guy shot a bunch of people and the subway ran over my hat.
I'm a little worried. He usually stops in for an eye-opener on the way to work.
Three... two... one... it's Ash Wednesday everybody! Set down your gins and confess your sins!
I never tire of that. Uh, one other announcement, at the end of the month we'll be participating in the Vice-President's Assessment Test.
Well, sir, of course He could... but then again... Wow, as melon-scratchers go, that's a honey-doodle.
"Prisoner 24601"... Why, I wore this for two years in a Viet Cong internment center. Never thought I'd see the old girl again.
I dreamed about her again last night, Smithers. You know that dream where you're in bed and they fly in through the window?
Yes, well, to have a successful baseball club, you need teamwork. Not some hot dog admissions officer playing by his own rules.
Yes, but you won't be looking through it. I forbid it. But you don't need a telescope to enjoy astronomy, Bart. There are all the constellations you've heard so much about.
You come all the way to Jerusalem -- the happiest place on earth -- and all the photos in your camera are of funny soda pops?!
You see, legend has it that on her deathbed, Saint Teresa of Avila had a vision of a jewel that would usher in an era of peace and harmony...
... And if anybody wants potato chips or anything fancy, tell 'em to go to hell.
Okay, punching isn't your thing. But that's okay... you're not that kind of fighter. What you're gonna do is stand there while your opponent gets exhausted from overpunching.
Call me old-fashioned, but movies were sexier when the actors kept their clothes on. Vilma Banky could do more for me with one raised eyebrow than an entire...
Hey there, Mr. Burns! For our half hour I thought we'd have a picnic in the park.
Heh, heh, heh. Heh, heh. Ohh, you'll find this amusing -- the suit Charlie Chaplin was buried in.
Yeah, the only reason you haven't been fired is because your file here was holdin' up a sofa that was missin' a leg.
How do you do it, Homer? How do you silence that little voice that says, "Think"?
Heh, heh. This is a tasty little lager that came all the way from Holland.
Oh, God. You smokers disgust me. Hey 'Pu, you got a breakfast cereal for people with syphilis?
We want ten percent of the first-dollar gross, full European distribution rights, and access to the most exclusive VIP tent in Sundance.
Fella came into the store today and asked for change for a dollar. Well sir, I gave him three quarters by mistake. Took me the whole afternoon to track him down.
Uh, no. Not yet. He still lives at the train yard. But he's a hungry young fighter. In fact, he's actually fighting for a sandwich.
Plus our last bake sale was a disaster. People took bites without buying the cookies.
...because you should be on Broadway chargin' a hundred bucks a ticket! You're a natural talent!

It's a letter from Homer. On my stationery. In my handwriting. Using my idioms and speech patterns. And it begins, "Dear Midge: you probably hate me by now, and if you don't, what's wrong which youse? But don't give up on men. Bart, Linda and the other one there need a Dad."
Whoa, check that out! / Stuff is getting' done! / Look at them renovations! / And... finished!
When Edna Met Seymour... "Ghost Willie"... "Killing Seymour's Mother"... "The Principal Who Sold A Screenplay"...
Sir, if we let these hill folk into our school, our test scores would drop so low, we'd lose all federal funding.
Years ago we received a government grant to improve the school. Unfortunately, I cashed it...and the money was in my pants when mother did the laundry.

Homer, I'm as permissive as the next parent. I mean, just yesterday, I let Todd buy some Red Hots with a cartoon devil on the box. But you can't possibly think it's appropriate for your ten-year-old son to work in a burlesque house!
Get going! And answer those phones, install a computer system, and rotate my office so the window faces the hills.
I don't wanna say it's ugly, but PETA called and said we should kill this one.
The point is, I've learned a lot about human nature by sitting in the park with mother. And one thing I've learned is children turn out like their parents. Behold, your future!
Yeah, well, the part that's showin'. I guess you could have a lot of weird scars, or a fake ass, or somethin'.
So, that's why I'm cleanin' things and flushin' things, and makin' this place look respectable.
Hmm. So mother was right -- it was my fault. Go ahead, water it down some more.
Simpson, I worked here for three-score and twain. That's sixty-two years in the "New English". Now, come with me, I want to show you something.
The only thing I know about strategy is that whatever the manager does, it's wrong, unless it works, in which case he's a button-pusher.
Well it don't matter no more, Midge. Carl is gone, and we're already auditioning replacements.
Hop to it, honey! If we get to the Pops concert early, we can give up our seats to some old people.
Smithers had thwarted my attempt to take candy from a baby, but with him out of the picture, I was free to wallow in my own crapulance.
Uh, listen, Homer, we'd love to help you, but we're not really set up for lepers.
I know this is highly illegal, but you're not leaving this booth till you punch "yes."
PLUS I GOTTA BE DRESSED AS A CIVIL WAR NURSE / AND THEN WHEN I'M FINISHED, I'LL GO THROUGH YOUR PURSE / BUT YOU COULD DO WORSE...
Ah, Simpson, you big virile son-of-a- gun. How would you like a check for two-thousand dollars?
Well, we hated being mad at ya, Homer, so we decided to make things right.

Usually people that tease me get thrown out on their ass. But, uh, your sayin' it made me feel good. Jeez, I sound like one of those guys in theM rom coms that play at the theater next to the theater I'm in.
Welcome to the American dream: a billionaire using public funds to construct a private playground for the rich and powerful.
Hey Homer, Ya know, I owe you one, buddy. No sooner had I shaved off the old cookie duster, than a lady cast me in a commercial.
THEN I DOUBT YOU'LL LIKE NED FLANDERS / OR HIS CREEPY LITTLE OFFSPRING, ROD AND TODD...
Isn't this great, Marge? We're like Jiminy Cricket for the whole ding-dang town. A half-man, half-bug that knows what's best for everybody. Um-hm.
Oh, excellent. Not only are the trains now running on time, they're running on metric time.
No problem. We simply unleash wave after wave of Chinese Needle Snakes. They'll wipe out the lizards.
Maggie's missing? You gotta let me help find her, please! We have a special bond. Even greater than her bond with the duck-shaped washcloth.
He's right. Can't we all get together and concentrate on our real enemies: monogamous gays and stem cells?
Good Lord! That canary was supposed to be my pigeon. I need to find a patsy quick!
Porky Pig's not a man, he's a pig! And he's not even a real pig!
Uh-oh, looks like I gotta wing it a little bit here. The other day I ran into an Irishman. Oh really? No, O'Reilly.
It's against hospital regulations, dammit! And Clive Dancer's just waitin' for me to slip up.
Now let's raise the roof for the bland informative rap of M. C. Safety and the Caution Crew!
Yes, thank you, Kent. Fifteen minutes from now I will wreak a terrible vengeance on this city. No one will be spared. No one!
Well, that broke the ice. Now, any man who lives till noon tomorrow shall win his freedom.
She took me to a mall and I never saw her again. But I'll never forget that image of her bolting for the parking lot.
If it makes you feel worse, I'm the man who bought the stock you sold.
Ladies and gentlemen, some new buddies of mine stopped by tonight. Maybe we can get 'em to come up here. How about a warm "Flaming Moe's" welcome for Aerosmith!
Uh, uh, huh, oh, hey, Rachel. W-Well what do you know? We both like plain vanilla with nothing on it.
Mr. Simpson, I dread the day when a hundred thousand dollars isn't worth groveling for.
I thought you might like this restaurant, Bart. They'll make a pizza pie with the topping of your choice.
Workers, please! There'll be time for the frozen pudding wagon later! You still owe me ten more Iroquois twists!

Think of the economy as a car and the rich man as the driver. If you don't give the driver all the money, he'll drive you over a cliff. It's just common sense. Furthermore, rich people feel things more deeply than the common man.
Oh well, there'll be plenty of time for explanations later. Right now, I'll be taking my puppies back.

See? You're a pig. Barney's a pig. Larry's a pig. We're all pigs. Except for one difference. Once in a while, we can crawl out of the slop, hose ourselves off, and act like human beings. Homer, buy your wife some flowers and take her out for a night on the town. Candles, tablecloth, the whole nine yards.
I'm sorry, Marge, I'm sorry, but it was Christmas and we were under the mistletoe...
Remember, guys, the truck only holds six carcasses, so don't shoot nothin' but trophy bucks, huh?
If you hand over the concert hall to me, I'll assume the debt and all of your problems will disappear.
Hey, come on, there's sexy bald like... uh... Babar, king of the elephants. I read his books as a kid. He married his cousin, Celeste. That was my takeaway.
L-Listen, folks, there's no magic formula. I just follow the three C's: clean living, chewing thoroughly, and a daily dose of Vitamin Church.
Yes, yes, yes. We have to do something. Although, the basketball hoops have been retracted... D.J. Funtimes has already cashed his deposit... And Superintendent Chalmers won't be happy to hear...
Maybe. But I feel a little like I'm the Tom Voyeur to these Huckleberry Sinners.
It does. We had thirty thousand here last night. Now play. The audience is gettin' restless.
Naw, naw, naw, we're goin' for the real thing. First class all the way. Come on, we can leave tonight.
Oh, the fire has spread to this room full of valuables. And it's our duty to follow it.
STELLA! STELLLA! CAN'T YOU HEAR ME YELL-A? / YOU'RE PUTTIN' ME THROUGH HELL-A / STELLA! STELLA!
This is a thousand monkeys working at a thousand typewriters. Soon they'll have written the greatest novel known to man.
So if you're looking for a half bag of charcoal briquettes, or an artificial Christmas tree -- trunk only, c'mon over to the Hibbert table. Pronto.
Aren't we in luck? Today's our tithe day and we've got ourselves a transient. Come in my friend. Let us feed and bathe you.
Oh, okay "Dude." I wouldn't want you to have a cow, "Man." Here's a catch-phrase you better learn for your adult years: "Hey, buddy, got a quarter?"
You know, Homer's givin' it the old bible college try. Maybe I should have dialed down the Doubting Thomas.
Now I can clearly see potential customers walk right past my store. Enjoy your shopping elsewhere!
Well, I consulted my bible and found some verses supporting what you want to do.
Now I'm thinkin' about ping-pong... a very fast chess game... a snappy David Mamet play...
Homer, Lenny...my man... I could never lie to you guys. I'm starting to get cold feet. Please don't tell anyone.
No, that's the beautiful part. When wintertime rolls around, the gorillas simply freeze to death.
Well Edna, for a school with no Asian kids, I think we put on a pretty darn good science fair.
If we didn't get them back by five, we'd be charged for the extra day.
They bought 'em a year ago, from the Mafia. It was the last of the family-owned teams.
After all these years, things are finally starting to go my way. I feel like celebrating. I...
And what book is that? The Ape Who Wanted A Big Bonus? Stop wasting my time, you corn-fed man-cow.
Gee, I always like to help you, Homer, but I don't want to be an accessory to some sort of shady doin's. And it does raise a whole host of ethical questions, such as...
Really? Hot damn! All right. Don't eat nothin' for the next three days, 'cause I'm takin' you out for a steak the size of a toilet seat!
Lord, give me guidance. That's right, the guidance department -- detention room. Thank you, Mrs. Lord.
Everyone relax, huh -- I know the Heimlich. I learned it a few years ago. It was nineteen ninety-seven, and "Titanic" was proving unsinkable at the box office...

Man, you go through life, you try to be nice to people, you struggle to resist the urge to punch 'em in the face, and for what?! For some pimply little puke to treat you like dirt unless you're on a "team!" Well I'm better than dirt... Well, most kinds of dirt... I mean, not that fancy store-bought dirt. That stuff's loaded with nutrients. I... I can't compete with that stuff.
Indeedily-doodily I do, and I love him just as much as you! It's a Flanders sandwich with great neighbor bread!
Oh? Well, I've always admired your tart honesty and ability to be personally offended by broad social trends.
And now, Homer, it's only fair that I give youse a gift: I'm gonna set the clock in the bar to the correct time.
Hey-hey there, Marge. Just brought the kids over to share a prayer with the blessed angel, if it's okay with you.
Bart, you wouldn't happen to know what sort of candy your Aunt Patty likes, would you?
I want you to punch me in the eye. If you do, then we're even, according to Exodus, Leviticus and Matthew.
...as teammates control the direction and speed of the stone by sweeping in front of it with a special broom.
It's kind of you to offer, Mr. Burns, but buzz around town is that you're, well, evil.
Hey there, well... it's my business partner, Mr. Smithers. Nice of you to drop by and not say nothin' that costs nobody no election.
I'm afraid that due to funding cuts, we've had to sell the Science Department skeleton and replace it with this Halloween costume.
My mother's ring. She gave it to me on her deathbed. She also acquired it on her deathbed. That was a very busy deathbed.
I'm burnin' up, here. Ooh, ooh, taking advantage of my alcohol soaked clothes. It's funny and it makes you think.
Thanks, Marge... Know-it-all bitch. Oh, uh, did I mention there was a mistake at the front desk?
It's so nice to be with someone who can't understand the horrible things I say.
Congratulations, Homer. Your Q is a huge success. A toast to the host who can boast the most roast.
Why that's a fabulous idea. Anything else you'd like? How about real lead in the radiation shields? Urinal cakes maybe? Smithers, throw this at him.
Mmm-hmm. I understand completely. The disturbing incident I was referring to happened this morning, when your son flushed an explosive device down the boys' lavatory.
Wow. Anyway, you don't think he could be at another bar, do you? Because I couldn't take that! I... uh... I-I just couldn't! I...
Yes, but we're prepared for that. We've lined up a fabulous type of gorilla that thrives on snake meat.
"Please excuse my handwriting. I busted whichever hand it is I write with. Signed, Mrs. Simpson." You were right to be suspicious, Edna. To the crime lab.
Oh, for the love of Peter! That's all anybody brought. Some damn fool went around telling everyone I love that slimy goop. Well, toss it in the pile over there.
Oh, hi-hi, Marge. I heard you and Homer broke up so, um, I'm declaring my intentions to move in on his territory. Here, I uh, brung you some posies.
I like you too, but you broke the law. So I've got to bring you in.
Now, ah, pizza's working well on Thursday, but I think the kids will follow it to Tuesday.
